title: Is being narcissistic and self deprecating mutually exclusive? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have to disagree with one point the other answerer made, that being that self-deprecation comes from low self-esteem. It doesn’t, and for the sake of the reader, it is NOT self-depreciation, it is self-deprecation, and to be self-deprecating keeps a wise man humble, as to be self deprecating is to be initially introspective in conflict, and important decision making. In the same way many want to lump empaths in with codependents, they also want to lump anything that takes away from the self into a category of deficit, and I don’t think that’s right, simply because those who lack humility, lack both compassion and empathy. This is not to say everyone who is self-deprecating isn’t indeed also codependent and suffering from a low self-image, or low self-esteem, as I’m sure self-deprecation goes a long way in helping oneself beat themselves up. A healthy level of honest evaluation, will include self-deprecation, unless of course one either cannot bear to, isn’t willing to, or is too self-centered to be introspective, such as Cluster B types, and toxic people in general. It wasn’t before we as a society went from Life magazine, to People magazine, to US magazine, and finally Self magazine, that social convention dictated to not put yourself above everyone else is to have low self esteem. I won’t preach, but I prefer my life to be one based on other centeredness, rather than self-centeredness, for many reasons, mostly though, because if I’m not keeping my prideful, arrogant and attention seeking ego in check, who’s going to? Because I believe left to our own devices, we will slip away from a when necessary “survival of the fittest” to a worldview espousing “survival of the fittest” and that to me, is the epitome of narcissism, and God help us if we continue down such a slippery slope as that. I think it’s pretty obvious, as the other answerer said, they are both indeed mutually exclusive, and I will go as far as to say they are also polar opposites. Let another give you accolades, and not your own lips. Thanks for reading, P Musings by Paul In-Ca

Being a narcassistic is basically being self centred and having a self esteem so low that everything a narc does is to fix his low self esteem. Self depreciating is also because of having low self esteem, but then you don't have to be a narcassist for self depreciation. To answer your question: Yes, they are mutually exclusive.
